title.narrative: 2.1. EARLY LEARNING AND PRE-SCHOOL

description.narrative: National and subnational institutions and systems have strengthened capacities to plan, implement and monitor quality early learning programmes, policies and strategies for children under 6 years old., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from inclusive, gender-sensitive quality learning and developmental services in both the home and school environments.

related-activity.ref: 3930/A0/05/882 OUTCOME2: EARLY CHILDHOOD-, PRIMARY-, SECONDARY-AGE EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and subnational institutions and systems have strengthened capacities to plan, implement and monitor quality earlylearning programmes, policies and strategies for children under 6 years old.

description.narrative: A total of 90,197 ECD and Foundation phase facilitators/teachers engaged in training on learning through play in early childhood development programmes and the foundation phase, while 211,095 young children were reached through 142,374 parents with UNICEF supported interventions such as the ECDmobi App, Tshwaragano Ka Bana: Let’s Play, Learn and Grow Together series. To address inclusion, all content is developed to be sensitive to the inclusion of children with disabilities. The first ever census of early childhood development programmes in the country commenced in 2021, which will, upon completion, improve planning, resourcing and monitoring of early learning and development programmes. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/01/2022
